messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]Jurassic Park
messages.msgSnippet: ... Has anyone read the JP books recently? I read JP and The Lost World years ago. I remember that there was a page towards the end of The Lost World that
messages.messageBody:
>>Jurassic Park is another great film.>>

Has anyone read the JP books recently? I read JP and The Lost World years
ago. I remember that there was a page towards the end of The Lost World that
really struck me. It seemed to me that the entire book, the entire problem
with those damn attacking dinos, was boiling down to the older generation
not being there to care for the younger generation. I remember, at the time,
feeling that it had a strong daycare implication. (Now I'd throw in
schooling vs. actually *being* with your children as well.)

I don't have the books here to find that page. Anyone else remember it?

~Mary
